ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.

ElementDescription: Sex of subject at birth
Notes: M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: Trauma Specify
Notes: Specified

ElementDescription: Question 1. Have you had upsetting thoughts or images about the event that came into your head when you didn't want them to?
Notes: 0=Not at all; 1=Once per week or less/a little ; 2=2-4 times per week/somewhat; 3=5 or more times per week/often

ElementDescription: Question 2. Have you been having bad dreams or nightmares about the event?
Notes: 0=Not at all; 1=Once per week or less/a little ; 2=2-4 times per week/somewhat; 3=5 or more times per week/often

ElementDescription: Question 3. Have you had the experience of acting or feeling as if the event was happening again (hearing something or seeing a picture about it and feeling as if you are there again)?
Notes: 0=Not at all; 1=Once per week or less/a little ; 2=2-4 times per week/somewhat; 3=5 or more times per week/often

ElementDescription: Question 4. Have you been feeling upset when you think about the event
Notes: 0=Not at all; 1=Once per week or less/a little ; 2=2-4 times per week/somewhat; 3=5 or more times per week/often

ElementDescription: Question 5. Have you been having feelings in your body when you think about or hear about the event
Notes: 0=Not at all; 1=Once per week or less/a little ; 2=2-4 times per week/somewhat; 3=5 or more times per week/often

ElementDescription: Question 6. Have you been trying not to think about, talk about or have feelings about the event?
Notes: 0=Not at all; 1=Once per week or less/a little ; 2=2-4 times per week/somewhat; 3=5 or more times per week/often

ElementDescription: Question 7. Have you been trying to avoid activities, people or places that remind you of the event
Notes: 0=Not at all; 1=Once per week or less/a little ; 2=2-4 times per week/somewhat; 3=5 or more times per week/often

ElementDescription: Question 8. Are there any important parts of the upsetting event that you still cannot remember?
Notes: 0=Not at all; 1=Once per week or less/a little ; 2=2-4 times per week/somewhat; 3=5 or more times per week/often

ElementDescription: Question 9. Are you much less interested in or stopped doing things you used to do?
Notes: 0=Not at all; 1=Once per week or less/a little ; 2=2-4 times per week/somewhat; 3=5 or more times per week/often

ElementDescription: Question 10. Have you noticed that you are not feeling close to people around you?
Notes: 0=Not at all; 1=Once per week or less/a little ; 2=2-4 times per week/somewhat; 3=5 or more times per week/often

ElementDescription: Question 11. Have you felt that you are not able to have strong feelings
Notes: 0=Not at all; 1=Once per week or less/a little ; 2=2-4 times per week/somewhat; 3=5 or more times per week/often

ElementDescription: Question 12. Have you felt as if your future plans or hopes will not come true
Notes: 0=Not at all; 1=Once per week or less/a little ; 2=2-4 times per week/somewhat; 3=5 or more times per week/often

ElementDescription: Question 13. Have you had trouble falling or staying asleep?
Notes: 0=Not at all; 1=Once per week or less/a little ; 2=2-4 times per week/somewhat; 3=5 or more times per week/often

ElementDescription: Question 14. Have you been feeling irritable or have fits of anger?
Notes: 0=Not at all; 1=Once per week or less/a little ; 2=2-4 times per week/somewhat; 3=5 or more times per week/often

ElementDescription: Question 15. Have you had trouble concentrating
Notes: 0=Not at all; 1=Once per week or less/a little ; 2=2-4 times per week/somewhat; 3=5 or more times per week/often

ElementDescription: Question 16. Have you been overly careful
Notes: 0=Not at all; 1=Once per week or less/a little ; 2=2-4 times per week/somewhat; 3=5 or more times per week/often

ElementDescription: Question 17. Have you been jumpy or easily startled
Notes: 0=Not at all; 1=Once per week or less/a little ; 2=2-4 times per week/somewhat; 3=5 or more times per week/often

ElementDescription: Question 18. Have the above problems gotten in the way with any of the following areas of your life SINCE THE EVENT? During your prayers?
Notes: 0=No; 1=Yes

ElementDescription: Question 19. Have the above problems gotten in the way with any of the following areas of your life SINCE THE EVENT?Chores and duties at home?
Notes: 0=No; 1=Yes

ElementDescription: Question 20.Have the above problems gotten in the way with any of the following areas of your life SINCE THE EVENT? Relationships with friends?
Notes: 0=No; 1=Yes

ElementDescription: Question 21. Have the above problems gotten in the way with any of the following areas of your life SINCE THE EVENT? Fun and hobby activities?
Notes: 0=No; 1=Yes

ElementDescription: Question 22.Have the above problems gotten in the way with any of the following areas of your life SINCE THE EVENT? Schoolwork?
Notes: 0=No; 1=Yes

ElementDescription: Question 23.Have the above problems gotten in the way with any of the following areas of your life SINCE THE EVENT? Relationships with your family?
Notes: 0=No; 1=Yes

ElementDescription: Question 24. Have the above problems gotten in the way with any of the following areas of your life SINCE THE EVENT? General happiness with your life?
Notes: 0=No; 1=Yes

ElementDescription: Child PTSD Symptom Scale (CPSS): Total score (4-point scale)
Notes: Sum of 4-point (rated 0-3) items cpss1-17

ElementDescription: Child PTSD Symptom Scale (CPSS): Re-Experiencing score (4-point scale)
Notes: Sum of 4-point (rated 0-3) items cpss1-5

ElementDescription: Child PTSD Symptom Scale (CPSS): Avoidance score (4-point scale)
Notes: Sum of 4-point (rated 0-3) items cpss6-12

ElementDescription: Child PTSD Symptom Scale (CPSS): Increased Arousal score (4-point scale)
Notes: Sum of 4-point (rated 0-3) items cpss13-17

ElementDescription: Timepoint/visit label
Notes: e.g., Baseline, Morning, At Bedtime

ElementDescription: Having upsetting thoughts or pictures about it that came into your head when you did not want them to
Notes: 0 = Not at all; 1 = Once per week or less/a little; 2 = 2-3 times per week/somewhat; 3 = 4-5 or more times per week/a lot; 4 = 6 or more times a week/almost always

ElementDescription: Having bad dreams or nightmares
Notes: 0 = Not at all; 1 = Once per week or less/a little; 2 = 2-3 times per week/somewhat; 3 = 4-5 or more times per week/a lot; 4 = 6 or more times a week/almost always

ElementDescription: Acting or feeling as if it was happening again (seeing or hearing something and feeling as if you are there again)
Notes: 0 = Not at all; 1 = Once per week or less/a little; 2 = 2-3 times per week/somewhat; 3 = 4-5 or more times per week/a lot; 4 = 6 or more times a week/almost always

ElementDescription: Feeling upset when you remember what happened (for example, feeling scared, angry, sad, guilty, confused)
Notes: 0 = Not at all; 1 = Once per week or less/a little; 2 = 2-3 times per week/somewhat; 3 = 4-5 or more times per week/a lot; 4 = 6 or more times a week/almost always

ElementDescription: Having feelings in your body when you remember what happened (for example, sweating, heart beating fast, stomach or head hurting)
Notes: 0 = Not at all; 1 = Once per week or less/a little; 2 = 2-3 times per week/somewhat; 3 = 4-5 or more times per week/a lot; 4 = 6 or more times a week/almost always

ElementDescription: Trying not to think about it or having feelings about it
Notes: 0 = Not at all; 1 = Once per week or less/a little; 2 = 2-3 times per week/somewhat; 3 = 4-5 or more times per week/a lot; 4 = 6 or more times a week/almost always

ElementDescription: Trying to stay away from anything that reminds you of what happened (for example, people, places, or conversations about it)
Notes: 0 = Not at all; 1 = Once per week or less/a little; 2 = 2-3 times per week/somewhat; 3 = 4-5 or more times per week/a lot; 4 = 6 or more times a week/almost always

ElementDescription: Not being able to remember an important part of what happened
Notes: 0 = Not at all; 1 = Once per week or less/a little; 2 = 2-3 times per week/somewhat; 3 = 4-5 or more times per week/a lot; 4 = 6 or more times a week/almost always

ElementDescription: Having bad thoughts about yourself, other people, or the world (for example, ''I cannot do anything righ'', ''All people are bad'', ''The world is a scary place'')
Notes: 0 = Not at all; 1 = Once per week or less/a little; 2 = 2-3 times per week/somewhat; 3 = 4-5 or more times per week/a lot; 4 = 6 or more times a week/almost always

ElementDescription: Thinking that what happened is your fault (for example, ''I should have known better'', ''I shouldn't have done that'', ''I deserved it'')
Notes: 0 = Not at all; 1 = Once per week or less/a little; 2 = 2-3 times per week/somewhat; 3 = 4-5 or more times per week/a lot; 4 = 6 or more times a week/almost always

ElementDescription: Having strong bad feelings (like fear, anger, guilt, or shame)
Notes: 0 = Not at all; 1 = Once per week or less/a little; 2 = 2-3 times per week/somewhat; 3 = 4-5 or more times per week/a lot; 4 = 6 or more times a week/almost always

ElementDescription: Having much less interest in doing things you used to do
Notes: 0 = Not at all; 1 = Once per week or less/a little; 2 = 2-3 times per week/somewhat; 3 = 4-5 or more times per week/a lot; 4 = 6 or more times a week/almost always

ElementDescription: Not feeling close to your friends or family or not wanting to be around them
Notes: 0 = Not at all; 1 = Once per week or less/a little; 2 = 2-3 times per week/somewhat; 3 = 4-5 or more times per week/a lot; 4 = 6 or more times a week/almost always

ElementDescription: Trouble having good feelings (like happiness or love) or trouble having any feelings at all
Notes: 0 = Not at all; 1 = Once per week or less/a little; 2 = 2-3 times per week/somewhat; 3 = 4-5 or more times per week/a lot; 4 = 6 or more times a week/almost always

ElementDescription: Getting angry easily (for example, yelling, hitting others, throwing things)
Notes: 0 = Not at all; 1 = Once per week or less/a little; 2 = 2-3 times per week/somewhat; 3 = 4-5 or more times per week/a lot; 4 = 6 or more times a week/almost always

ElementDescription: Doing things that might hurt yourself (for example, taking drugs, drinking alcohol, running away, cutting yourself)
Notes: 0 = Not at all; 1 = Once per week or less/a little; 2 = 2-3 times per week/somewhat; 3 = 4-5 or more times per week/a lot; 4 = 6 or more times a week/almost always

ElementDescription: Being very careful or on the lookout for danger (for example, checking to see who is around you and what is around you)
Notes: 0 = Not at all; 1 = Once per week or less/a little; 2 = 2-3 times per week/somewhat; 3 = 4-5 or more times per week/a lot; 4 = 6 or more times a week/almost always

ElementDescription: Being jumpy or easily scared (for example, when someone walks up behind your, when you hear a loud noise)
Notes: 0 = Not at all; 1 = Once per week or less/a little; 2 = 2-3 times per week/somewhat; 3 = 4-5 or more times per week/a lot; 4 = 6 or more times a week/almost always

ElementDescription: Having trouble paying attention (for example, losing track of a story on TV, forgetting what you read, unable to pay attention in class)
Notes: 0 = Not at all; 1 = Once per week or less/a little; 2 = 2-3 times per week/somewhat; 3 = 4-5 or more times per week/a lot; 4 = 6 or more times a week/almost always

ElementDescription: Having trouble falling or staying asleep
Notes: 0 = Not at all; 1 = Once per week or less/a little; 2 = 2-3 times per week/somewhat; 3 = 4-5 or more times per week/a lot; 4 = 6 or more times a week/almost always

ElementDescription: Child PTSD Symptom Scale (CPSS): Total score (5-point scale)
Notes: Sum of 5-point (rated 0-4) items cpss_1-17

ElementDescription: Child PTSD Symptom Scale (CPSS): Re-Experiencing score (5-point scale)
Notes: Sum of 5-point (rated 0-4) items cpss_1-5

ElementDescription: Child PTSD Symptom Scale (CPSS): Avoidance score (5-point scale)
Notes: Sum of 5-point (rated 0-4) items cpss_6-12

ElementDescription: Child PTSD Symptom Scale (CPSS): Increased Arousal score (5-point scale)
Notes: Sum of 5-point (rated 0-4) items cpss_13-17

ElementDescription: Form used/assessment name
Notes: e.g., Self-Report, Parent Form, Short Form, Revised Version

ElementDescription: Have the problems above been getting in the way of these parts of your life in the past month: Fun things you want to do?
Notes: 0=No; 1=Yes

ElementDescription: Have the problems above been getting in the way of these parts of your life in the past month: Doing your chores?
Notes: 0=No; 1=Yes

ElementDescription: Have the problems above been getting in the way of these parts of your life in the past month: Relationships with your friends?
Notes: 0=No; 1=Yes

ElementDescription: Have the problems above been getting in the way of these parts of your life in the past month: Praying?
Notes: 0=No; 1=Yes

ElementDescription: Have the problems above been getting in the way of these parts of your life in the past month: Schoolwork?
Notes: 0=No; 1=Yes

ElementDescription: Have the problems above been getting in the way of these parts of your life in the past month: Relationships with your family?
Notes: 0=No; 1=Yes

ElementDescription: Have the problems above been getting in the way of these parts of your life in the past month: Being happy with your life?
Notes: 0=No; 1=Yes
